intro: Phacelia minor var. whitlavia, commonly known as the Whitlavia phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It has slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. This species is often found in open habitats such as hillsides and dry meadows.
